intro: Rhododendron faucium, commonly known as the Italian rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are dark green, leathery, and arranged in whorls around the stems. Rhododendron faucium thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
